name: Counter-glyph
description:
When you draw this glyph over a minor glyph it supresses the first glyph for an hour before fading.
 **Modifications**
 DC 30: Leaves no trace that is was cast.

name: Daemon Ward
description: When you draw this glyph over a doorway or other aperture any true daemon must pass a will save in order to pass through the door. This glyph lasts for a year and a day.

name: Disguise
description:
When you draw this glyph on a creature?s collar bones, they can tap the glyph to activate a disguise, chosen when the glyph is drawn. The disguise only covers the creature?s head and cannot add or remove major features. It can change hair colour, skin colour, make ears different shapes or add scaring or other facial features. 
 Close inspection reveals the face to be a disguise. Once activated the glyph lasts for an hour before it needs 8 hours to recharge. 
 This glyph lasts until the creature has been dead for a week.
 **Modifications** 
 DC 20: Add another disguise by paying 100 extra silver. 100 silver and an increased DC by 5 for each additional disguise.

name: Flames
description:
When you draw this glyph on an object you can strike it softly to cause a small flame to burn for a moment, allowing you to light torches or small fires. 
    This glyph lasts for a year.

name: Healing
description: When you draw this glyph on a wounded creature it gains a +2 bonus on fortitude saves to heal a wound naturally and any creature attempting a medicine check to heal a wound on the creature gains a +2 bonus on that check. This glyph lasts for a day or until the creature is no longer wounded or dies.

name: Light
description:
When you draw this glyph on a surface it emits a soft light for 30 ft around it.
 **Modifications** 
DC 20: Make the light turn on and off when touched. Costs 250 silver.
 DC 25: Make the light permanent. Costs 2000 silver.

name: Linking
description: When you draw this glyph you mark two objects with matching glyphs. You can choose what sort of link to create between the two objects. The further away the two links are the more energy is lost between them.

This Glyph can be made more powerful with more materials, up to 100 times its base strength and cost. 
 The glyph lasts an hour.
 **Modifications** 
      DC 20: Glyph lasts a day for 10x cost DC 30: Glyph lasts a week for 100x cost 
 DC 40: Glyph lasts forever for 1000x cost
**Thermal Link**

Heat will share between the two objects as if they were touching. The more distance between the two objects the more heat that will be lost in the transfer. 
 **Modifications** 
 DC 25: Heat only transfers in one direction (ish) for extra 100 silver.
**Magnetic Link**

The two objects will act like magnets to each other and only to each other.
 **Modifications** 
 DC 20: Objects repel rather than attract.
**Kinetic Link**

The two objects will move with each other. 
 **Modifications**
 DC 30: Reverse Direction of Movement.

name: Locking
description:
When you draw this glyph on a door or other lockable object you can designate a password. Unless the password is uttered the DC to unlock or smash open this door is increased by 10.
 This glyph lasts a year and a day.

name: Magic Detection
description:
This glyph glows when within 10ft. of strong magic. 
 This glyph lasts forever.

name: Masking
description: This glyph can be placed on a small object. It can make an old object look new, or a new object look old. It can change the colour or appearance of an object but not its shape. This glyph lasts for a week before it fades.

name: Mending
description: This glyph can be placed on a broken or damaged object. The object slowly repairs itself, taking up to a day for severely damaged objects. Once the object is complete the glyph fades. This glyph cannot repair things damaged directly by magic (the flames from a fireball are normal fire, for example). A single glyph of mending cannot repair cuts or breaks longer than a 6 inches in metal or stone, or 2 feet in materials like cloth or leather.

name: Sealing
description: When you draw this glyph on a door or other lockable object you can seal it against breaking. The DC to smash or pick the lock or door is increased by 20. This glyph lasts for an hour.

name: Silence
description:
This glyph can be placed on a door or closed window to make sound unable to pass through the door or window while the door or window remains closed. It can be placed on a wall, floor, or roof as well for similar effect. The glyph covers a 15 ft. square. 
 The glyph can also be placed on a ranged weapon to make it silent. Bows and crossbows are made completely silent. Firearms are mostly muffled but still make some sound. A glyph of silence on a firearm has 6 charges, expending one charge each time it fires. It regains 1d4 charges per hour. 
    This glyph lasts for a year and a day.

name: Striking
description:
This glyph can be placed on a person’s arms or hands. The person use their turn to activate the glyph, sending a wave of force flying outwards. Select a target within 15 ft. and make a spell attack roll using the crafter’s spell attack. On a hit the target takes 5d8 damage. This glyph needs a week to recharge. 
 This glyph lasts for a year and a day.

name: Traps
description:
This glyph can be placed on a surface. When you draw this glyph, you can select up to eight creatures to be unaffected by it. You also cast a damaging spell into the glyph. When any other creature willingly touches or steps over the glyph they are targeted by the spell. If the spell would normally effect an area, the area is centred on the glyph. 
This glyph lasts for a year and a day or until triggered.
 **Modifications** DC: 25: This glyph recharges over a week after being triggered. 
 DC 30: This glyph lasts forever for 100x normal cost.

name: Undeath Ward
description:
When you draw this glyph over a doorway or other aperture any undead must pass a will save in order to pass through the door. 
 This glyph lasts for a year and a day.

name: Warning
description:
When you draw this glyph on an object it will make a loud sound when any creature besides you touches it.
 This glyph lasts a year and a day. 
** Modifications**
 DC 20: You can specify up to 8 additional creatures who can touch this item for 50 silver each.
